thread.title: Lynn Olsen, Ph.D. Joins Logile's Advisory Board

author: cnbc.com
title: Lynn Olsen, Ph.D. Joins Logile's Advisory Board

organizations.name: university of st. thomas opus college of business

text:
DALLAS--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Logile, Inc. announces that Lynn Olsen, Ph.D., CEO of The Innovation Group, Inc. and former Corporate Vice President of Retail Operations at SUPERVALU, has joined Logile as an advisory board member.
During his 27-year career at SUPERVALU, Lynn held many leadership roles in retail operations, merchandising, leadership development and training, and leading large-scale change initiatives. Lynn held assignments at many levels, including Assistant Franchise Director, Division Director, Corporate Category Management Director, Corporate Vice President Retail Business Change, and Corporate Vice President Retail Operations.
After retiring from SUPERVALU, he founded The Innovation Group, where he provides thought leadership to senior leaders on a broad range of complex issues. Lynn also serves as an adjunct faculty member at University of St. Thomas Opus College of Business in Minneapolis/St. Paul, where he resides.
Lynn has a unique blend of experience as an executive, senior management consultant, and academic. A lifelong learner, Lynn holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Management from Cardinal Stritch University, an MBA from the University of St. Thomas, and a Ph.D. in Leadership and Change from Antioch University. His doctoral research centered on the leadership demands involved in transformational change.
Logile’s Founder and CEO, Purna Mishra, stated, “Lynn’s range of experience, consulting skills and business scholarship will help support Logile’s transformation from being an industry leader in Workforce and Execution Management software and professional services to becoming an even more significant player with an even larger industry footprint in the store operational planning and execution support and compliance marketplace. His knowledge will help our strategic direction to deliver the highest value to Logile’s valued customers. He will also be a great support to our executive leadership team as we continue to grow, and I am honored to have his advice and experience on our Retail Advisory Board.”
Lynn Olsen stated, “Logile has built industry leading solutions for labor management accurate daily forecasting, task-based wall-to-wall scheduling, and task management, all built on a foundation of incredibly accurate, store-specific labor standards and an enterprise labor model. These were foundations that my peers and I envisioned and championed during our tenures at leading retailers. With the right solution from Logile’s unique combination of software, industrial engineering expertise, and retail operations acumen, I see that our vision for an accurate and agile workforce to support our customers is becoming a reality. I have seen and heard from my peers what Logile has accomplished and the difference they see in their stores. Logile’s long-standing success with leading retailers, and its recognition in the latest RIS Leadership Board rankings, speaks volumes about its potential for growth. I am excited to be a part of Logile’s future growth and expansion to deliver systems and expertise critical for retail success.”
About Logile
Logile, Inc., a Texas based company, was incorporated in 2005 and remains privately held with software development and quality assurance teams located in the United States, the United Kingdom, the European Union, China, and India and industrial engineers and seasoned retail consulting teams located across the United States and Latin America.
